newsitem.title: UK: UK's FTSE 100 sets week's third closing record.
newsitem.headline: UK's FTSE 100 sets week's third closing record.

text.p: The UK's FTSE 100 index powered to its third record close of the week on Friday as gilts extended Thursday's sharp gains and Wall Street advanced.

Ending above 4,200 for the first time ever, the index closed 10.2 points higher at 4,207.7, in a day dominated for many trading desks by the sale of 135 million Guinness shares by LVMH of France -- which pushed trading volume to over 1 billion shares.
The FTSE 250 index of midcap stocks also set a record, up 17.5 points at 4,583.4, surpassing its peak of 4568.6 set as long ago as April 1996.
